repository.corpname: University of Nevada, Reno. DeLaMare Science & Engineering Library

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) was formed as part of the Energy Reorganization Act of 1974. The NRC is responsible for regulating nuclear fuel cycle and waste management activities; as well as commercial, industrial, medical, and academic uses of nuclear energy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission Yucca Mountain Research Collection, University Libraries, University of Nevada, Reno.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: During its time as a Nuclear Regulatory Commission depository, the University of Nevada, Reno collected thousands of documents related to the potential nuclear waste repository at Yucca Mountain, Nevada. The collection includes U.S. Government issued reports and contractor work related to the proposed site, as well as email communications, letters, research articles, books, educational pamphlets, maps, and other materials related to Yucca Mountain nuclear waste repository activities. Please see associated U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission Yucca Mountain Research Collection LibGuide for more information about this collection, along with links to other related resources. This collection is housed at the DeLaMare Science & Engineering Library, basement floor.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Materials must be used on-site. Access to parts of this collection may be restricted under provisions of state or federal law.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: As part of the NRC’s Code of Federal Regulations, Local Public Document Rooms (LPDRs) containing information about NRC activities and research were established near civilian nuclear power reactor sites and nuclear waste sites around the country. The Yucca Mountain Research Collection was acquired by the UNR during its time as a LPDR for the NRC beginning in 1989.
